module.description: Video Processing Subsystem - read-only status registers (spec version: 1.00.w.11)

bitfield.description: Write buffer memory overflow (CCDC) All data units have been filled and not yet transferred to SDRAM before the next data unit is to be filled from the WBL. Software has to clear the bit.
Write buffer memory overflow (Preview engine) All data units have been filled and not yet transferred to SDRAM before the next data unit is to be filled from the WBL. Software has to clear the bit.
Write buffer memory overflow (Resizer line 1) All data units have been filled and not yet transferred to SDRAM before the next data unit is to be filled from the WBL. Software has to clear the bit.
Write buffer memory overflow (Resizer line 2) All data units have been filled and not yet transferred to SDRAM before the next data unit is to be filled from the WBL. Software has to clear the bit.
Write buffer memory overflow (Resizer line 3) All data units have been filled and not yet transferred to SDRAM before the next data unit is to be filled from the WBL. Software has to clear the bit.
Write buffer memory overflow (Resizer line 4) All data units have been filled and not yet transferred to SDRAM before the next data unit is to be filled from the WBL. Software has to clear the bit.
Write buffer memory overflow (AF) All data units have been filled and not yet transferred to SDRAM before the next data unit is to be filled from the WBL. Software has to clear the bit.
Write buffer memory overflow (AE/AWB) All data units have been filled and not yet transferred to SDRAM before the next data unit is to be filled from the WBL. Software has to clear the bit.
VBUSM priority in the system (to the DDR EMIF) The default should be the highest priority in the system

Individual module register command number Note that for the modules that only have 2 individual requestors, this field will only display either 0 or 1. For modules that have 4 individual requestors, this field will display 0 or 1 or 2 or 3.

register.description: SDRAM non real-time read request expand

bitfield.description: Preview engine read request expand The number of clock cycles (150 MHz in normal mode) to allow between two consecutive read requests from the module. This is for non real-time reads and spreading them with respect to the other traffic in the system thereby allowing lesser priority requests in the system to not be locked out during the duration of a frame being read from SDRAM

Resizer read request expand The number of clock cycles (150 MHz in normal mode) to allow between two consecutive read requests from the module. This is for non real-time reads and spreading them with respect to the other traffic in the system thereby allowing lesser priority requests in the system to not be locked out during the duration of a frame being read from SDRAM

Histogram read request expand The number of clock cycles (150 MHz in normal mode) to allow between two consecutive read requests from the module. This is for non real-time reads and spreading them with respect to the other traffic in the system thereby allowing lesser priority requests in the system to not be locked out during the duration of a frame being read from SDRAM
